io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventSubscribers

Class SyncEventSubscriber

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventSubscriber
      • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.ProcessingSingleEventSubscriber
        • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.ProcessingSingleEventErrorSubscriber
          • io.github.kushnirvladyslav.EventSubscribers.SyncEventSubscriber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class SyncEventSubscriber
extends ProcessingSingleEventErrorSubscriber
    Synchronous event subscriber that processes events in the calling thread. Extends ProcessingSingleEventErrorSubscriber to provide synchronous event processing with error handling capabilities.

    Unlike AsyncEventSubscriber, this subscriber processes events synchronously when processEvents() is called, making it suitable for scenarios where immediate event processing is required.

    Since:
    2025-07-31
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vladyslav Kushnir
    See Also:
    ProcessingSingleEventErrorSubscriber

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts or resumes event subscription if the subscriber is in an appropriate state.
        Specified by:
        run in class EventSubscriber
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the subscriber is shut down

      • processEvents

        public void processEvents()
        Processes all currently queued events synchronously in the calling thread. This method will process events until the queue is empty.

        Note: This method does not block waiting for new events.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Temporarily pauses event processing.
        Specified by:
